availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Holdship (Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, clerk and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, clerk and commissioner of deeds. Pennsylvania native. Married to Maria Holdship. Father of Charles Holdship and George W. Holdship. Clerk for the Pittsburgh and Boston Mining Company in 1861. Assistant secretary and treasurer of the Pittsburgh and Boston Mining Company in 1863. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Pennsylvania in 1865.

bibl.p: Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Pennsylvania, Allegheny County, Allegheny Ward 4, p. 66; The Pittsburgh Daily Commercial (Pittsburgh, Pa.), November 24, 1863, p. 1; Find A Grave, "Henry Holdship (1825-1897)," Memorial #122389150, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=122389150&ref=acom (accessed May2, 2017); Directory of Pittsburgh and Allegheny Cities . . . for 1861-62 (Pittsburgh: George H. Thurston, 1861), 138.
